p: Interestingly, among the top-100 genes of the “Stilbenoids” LGN expansion ( Supplementary Table S2 ), there is a Group II WRKY transcription factor, VvWRKY18, which represents a potential new interesting candidate for the regulation of this pathway. On the other hand, the VvWRKY genes proposed by Vannozzi et al. (2018) as involved in the regulation of VvSTS genes are not present in the NES 2RA output. The approach of Gene Co-expression Network analysis based on the MR index of co-expression proved to be more suited to identify direct interactions, such as the regulator of a target. Nonetheless, NES 2RA expansion of VvSTS29 actually identifies VvWRKY03 (not shown), confirming that when applied to a single gene, the two approaches produce similar results.
